onyomiExamples.meaning: patching up (e.g. a failure), covering up (e.g. a mistake), glossing over

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to paint, to plaster, to lacquer, to varnish, to spread, to smear, to put up (wallpaper)
to repaint, to paint again, to break (a record), to rewrite, to remake
Shunkei lacquerware, lacquerware created using transparent lacquer on yellow or red-stained wood, allowing the natural wood grain to be seen
intermediate coat of paint or lacquer, second coat
to be smeared, to be covered
